document.title: Lévy’s inequality, Rademacher sums, and Kahane’s inequality

para.p:
Let
( Ω , A , P )
be a probability space. A random variable is a Borel measurable function
→ Ω R
. For a random variable
X
, we denote by
⁢
X *
P
the pushforward measure of
P
by
X
.
⁢
X *
P
is a Borel probability measure on
R
, called the distribution of
X
. A random variable
X
is called symmetric when the distribution of
X
is equal to the distribution of
- X
. Because the collection
{
(
- ∞
, a ]

∈ a R

σ

R

P

*
P
is equivalent to the statement that for all
∈ a R

The following is Lévy’s inequality. 1 1 footnote 1 Joe Diestel, Hans Jarchow, and Andrew Tonge, Absolutely Summing Operators, p. 213, Theorem 11.3.

Because each

Math.text: P * U _ k = P * (A _ k intersection B)
P * U _ k
absent = P * (A _ k intersection B)
absent = P * X ^ (- 1) * H _ k
absent = P * X ^ (- 1) * H _ k
absent = X _ * * P * H _ k
absent = X _ * * P * H _ k
absent = X _ k _ * * P * H _ k
absent = X _ k _ * * P * H _ k
absent = P * (X _ k) ^ (- 1) * H _ k
absent = P * (X _ k) ^ (- 1) * H _ k
absent = P * (A _ k intersection conditional-set@(omega element-of Omega, norm@(T _ (list@(n, k)) * omega) >= a))
absent = P * (A _ k intersection conditional-set@(omega element-of Omega, norm@(T _ (list@(n, k)) * omega) >= a))
absent = P * V _ k
absent = P * V _ k

para.p: among the above equalities, the two equalities that deserve chewing on are

Math.text: formulae@(P * (A _ k intersection B) = list@(P * X ^ (- 1) * H _ k, [and]), P * (X _ k) ^ (- 1) * H _ k = P * (A _ k intersection conditional-set@(omega element-of Omega, norm@(T _ (list@(n, k)) * omega) >= a)))

para.p: Thus we have

Math.text: P * A _ k = P * (U _ k union V _ k) less= P * U _ k + P * V _ k = 2 * P * U _ k = 2 * P * (A _ k intersection B)

para.p: Therefore

Math.text: P * A
absent = ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ n)@(P * A _ k)
absent less= ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ n)@(2 * P * (A _ k intersection B))
absent less= ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ n)@(2 * P * (A _ k intersection B))
absent = 2 * P * (A intersection B)
absent = 2 * P * (A intersection B)
absent = 2 * P * B
absent = 2 * P * B

para.p: proving the claim. ∎

We now use Lévy’s inequality to prove the following for independent random variables with the Rademacher distribution. 3 3 footnote 3 Joe Diestel, Hans Jarchow, and Andrew Tonge, Absolutely Summing Operators, p. 214, Lemma 11.4.

para.p: and therefore, by (),

para.p: which proves the claim. ∎
